alert.note: Alert for Allen; Neosho; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 13 at 2:29AM CDT until July 13 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTHWESTERN ALLEN, NORTHWESTERN NEOSHO, NORTHERN WILSON AND SOUTHERN WOODSON COUNTIES... At 229 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 8 inches of rain have fallen so far. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area overnight. Flash flooding is a strong possibility. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, low-water crossing, low-lying areas, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chanute, Humboldt, Yates Center, Toronto, Buffalo, Benedict, Earlton, Rose, Chanute Airport, Petrolia, Batesville, Toronto Lake and Cross Timbers State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
